summary: This FBI Tactical Intelligence Report details research conducted on Roderic Alexander Innes Hamilton, identified as a potential defense witness in the Ghislaine Maxwell trial. The report compiles his travel records, business associations, and biographical information, and poses key investigative questions about his relationship to Maxwell, Epstein, and the victims.

persons.name: Roderic Alexander Innes Hamilton
persons.role: Person of Interest / Potential Defense Witness
persons.context: Subject of an FBI intelligence report investigating his potential role as a defense witness in the Ghislaine Maxwell trial. The report details his travel to the US and his directorship of a UK company.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Central subject of the FBI's child sex trafficking investigation. The report is part of the investigation into her case, specifically researching her potential defense witnesses.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named alongside Ghislaine Maxwell as a perpetrator in the child sex trafficking investigation that forms the basis for this intelligence report.

connections.description: Hamilton is identified as a potential defense witness for Ghislaine Maxwell, indicating a suspected connection that the FBI is investigating.
The FBI report explicitly questions the relationship between Hamilton and Jeffrey Epstein as part of its investigation.

events.title: Ghislaine Maxwell Trial Begins
events.description: The criminal trial for Ghislaine Maxwell on child sex trafficking charges commenced.

events.title: Defense Witness List Received
events.description: FBI New York C-20 received a potential list of defense witnesses for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial.

events.title: Hamilton's Last Inbound US Travel
events.description: Roderic Hamilton last traveled into the United States, arriving at JFK from London Heathrow.

events.title: Hamilton's Last Outbound US Travel
events.description: Roderic Hamilton last departed the United States, flying from Newark to London Heathrow.

locations: Flat 11 Southside Quarter, 38 Burns Rd London, England, SW115GY (Releev Limited address)
keyFacts: The FBI was actively investigating potential defense witnesses for Ghislaine Maxwell's trial as of December 2021, indicating ongoing intelligence gathering during the legal proceedings.
Roderic Alexander Innes Hamilton, a UK national, was a director of the now-dissolved UK company Releev Limited.
Hamilton's last known travel to the United States was a brief trip from February 5 to February 7, 2016, several years before Maxwell's arrest and trial.

The FBI's key unanswered questions from this report are the nature of Hamilton's relationship with Ghislaine Maxwell and/or Jeffrey Epstein, and whether he knew any of the victims in the investigation.
The document is a tactical intelligence product for internal FBI use, not for legal proceedings, highlighting the operational phase of the investigation.
